intro: Chazaliella sciadephora, commonly known as the desert bell, is a striking flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments with minimal water. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chazaliella sciadephora is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
